Package edu.lehigh.cse.lol

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ScreenManager
    ScreenManager presents a set of related screens, such as playable levels.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Actor
    Actor is the base class upon which every game actor is built.
    Animation
    Animation is a way of describing a set of images that can be used to animate an actor.
    Background
    The Background class provides a way to declare images that go in the background of the game, and which automatically pan and repeat.
    Control
    LOL Games have a heads-up display (hud).
    Destination
    Destinations are actors that the hero should try to reach.
    Display
    LOL Games have a heads-up display (hud).
    Enemy
    Enemies are things to be avoided or defeated by the hero.
    Facts
    The Fact interface provides a way for the programmer to store per-level, per-session, and per-game (persistent) information about the game.
    Goodie
    Goodies are actors in a game whose main purpose is for the hero to collect them.
    Hero
    The Hero is the focal point of a game.
    Level
    A Level is an interactive portion of the game.
    Lol
    A Lol object is the outermost container for all of the functionality of the game.
    LolCallback
    LolCallback provides an easy way to describe code that should run in response to special events, such as timers, screen presses, or collisions between actors.
    LoseScene
    LoseScene provides a way to display text and images after a level is lost, before gameplay resumes.
    Media
    The MediaFactory provides a mechanism for registering all of our images, sounds, and fonts Strictly speaking, we can re-create fonts on the fly whenever we need to.
    Obstacle
    Obstacles are usually walls, except they can move, and can be used to run all sorts of abritrary code that changes the game, or the behavior of the things that collide with them.
    PauseScene
    PauseScene provides a way to suspend gameplay briefly and display information to the player.
    Physics
    Game designers can configure the physics of a level (i.e., the default forces, if any), via this class.
    PreScene
    PreScene provides a way to put a pop-up on the screen before a level begins.
    Projectile
    Projectiles are actors that can be thrown from the hero's location in order to remove enemies.
    ProjectilePool
    The ProjectilePool is the public interface to Projectiles.
    Route
    A Route specifies a set of points that an actor will move between at a fixed speed.
    Score
    Score encapsulates the data used by a Level to track the player's progress.
    Svg
    The Svg infrastructure allows the game designer to load SVG line drawings into a game.
    Tilt
    Tilt provides a mechanism for moving actors on the screen.
    Util
    The Util class stores a few helper functions that we use inside of LOL, and a few simple wrappers that we give to the game developer
    WinScene
    WinScene provides a way to display text and images after a level is won, before gameplay resumes.
